cs691.assignment04

Class RPEnsembleDistanceFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs691.assignment04.AbstractDistanceMeasure
      • cs691.assignment04.RPEnsembleDistanceFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    weka.core.DistanceFunction, weka.core.OptionHandler

    public class RPEnsembleDistanceFunction
extends AbstractDistanceMeasure
    This class implements Weka's DistanceFunction interface in order to use the similarity values calculated during the repetitions of the Random Projection (RP)+EM runs directly with Weka's HierarchicalClustering algorithm instead of having to implement your own HierarchicalClustering algorithm. Technically this class extends the AbstractDistanceMeasure class which implements the needed interface plus hides a lot of unused functions to reduce code complexity.
    Author:
    sloscal1

    • Field Detail

      • simValues

        private PairwiseStorage simValues
        The similarity values that were calculated during the RP+EM phase

      • instanceToIndex

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Integer> instanceToIndex
        A mapping from Instances to indices. This is used because Weka expects a distance function to be calculated on-the-fly but we already have similarity values that we would like to use. We have those values indexed by their position in the Instances object, so we need a way to convert from Instance objects to their respective index in the Instances object. This object provides that mapping.

      • maxSimilarity

        private double maxSimilarity
        A maximum similarity value is needed to convert from similarity (computed in the simValues) to distance (needed by the Hierarchical clustering algorithm.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RPEnsembleDistanceFunction

        public RPEnsembleDistanceFunction(weka.core.Instances data,
                                  PairwiseStorage simValues)
        Create the distance function object to be used in the HierarchicalClusterer. It requires both the data used in the work as well as the similarity values that have been previously computed.
        Parameters:
        data - must not be null
        simValues - must not be null

    • Method Detail

      • distance

        public double distance(weka.core.Instance arg0,
                       weka.core.Instance arg1)

      • instanceHash

        private long instanceHash(weka.core.Instance inst)
        This is a quick hash function implementation that seems to work okay for the data I have tested... This requires O(n) work (where n is the number of attributes) - I can't cache it either since the Instances continue to be copied whenever Weka requests a distance lookup. This could be made much more efficient if we implemented our own HierarchicalClusterer.
        Parameters:
        inst - and Instance object to generate a hashcode for must not be null
        Returns:
        a hashcode.
